step1.ptxt: Faults and Symptoms of Common Rail Diesel Components

item.ptxt: Lack of power (no black smoke) due to air filter blockage or crushed or leaking air duct
Black smoke (no lack of power) due to leakage between the turbocharger and intake manifold

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, rough idle, knocking, white smoke (when cold)

item.ptxt: Measure the resistance of the glow plug
Check the glow plug indicator light
When cranking during the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test, if there is a high speed cylinder, approx. 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, that cylinder may lose compression.
When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder.

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Common Rail Pressure, Target Common Rail Pressure, Target Pump SCV Current

item.ptxt: Common Rail Pressure is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.
The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.
When Target Pump SCV Current is 3000 mA or higher, the suction control valve has a tendency to become stuck.

entry.ptxt: Even if Common Rail Pressure is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Blockage, increase in fuel injection volume
Rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking

item.ptxt: When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder. This value can be read after idling for 1 minute.

When the sliding resistance of the internal parts of the injector assemblies has increased due to internal contamination, injection quantity will increase at high common rail pressure due to a delay in fuel injector closure.

When black smoke occurs due to contamination of the injector assemblies, there are usually other symptoms, such as engine knocking noise at cold idling, rough idling, difficulty starting, etc., which are also present when the common rail pressure is low.

entry.ptxt: Circuit fault: The fuel injector does not open.
Difficult to start, rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking
When the injector driver has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Open circuit, decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)
Difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, lack of power
Common Rail Pressure, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Slowly raise the engine speed from idling to 3000 rpm with the vehicle stopped and check that Common Rail Pressure follows Target Common Rail Pressure. If the fuel pressure sensor malfunctions, the actual fuel pressure may deviate from the target fuel pressure (either Common Rail Pressure decreases to a value less than Target Common Rail Pressure).

entry.ptxt: When the fuel pressure sensor has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Difficult to start, rough idle (especially when cold)

item.ptxt: Does not move smoothly
Does not close completely
Rough idle
EGR valve stuck closed: A loud turbocharger sound.

EGR valve stuck open: Difficult to start (does not stall), black smoke, lack of power (if there is an excess in the quantity of EGR and there is a heavy load, when the vehicle starts moving, a lack of power will be felt).

entry.ptxt: Actual EGR Valve Pos, Target EGR Valve Pos

item.ptxt: Generally, Actual EGR Valve Pos = Target EGR Valve Pos +/-5% (fully closed: 0%, fully open: 100%).

Using the EGR valve Active Test, check whether Actual EGR Valve Pos follows Target EGR Valve Pos (the engine coolant temperature and intake air temperature should be considered when a malfunction occurs).
EGR valve is fully closed when the ignition switch is turned to ON (the engine is stopped).
EGR valve opens to the halfway point at idling after the engine is warmed up.
When leaving the vehicle idling, the normal range of EGR Close Lrn. Val. is 0 to 1 V.
In cases when EGR Close Lrn. Val. is out of the normal range (0 to 1 V), it is possible that the EGR valve cannot completely close.
Stuck closed: Lack of power, difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, black smoke. These may occur when stuck almost fully closed.
Stuck open: Turbocharger sound increases. When the engine is stopped, engine vibrations may occur.

entry.ptxt: Actual Throttle Position, Actual Throttle Position #2

item.ptxt: 0%: Fully closed
100%: Fully open

When the ignition switch to ON (the engine is stopped), the diesel throttle is fully open. When idling, the diesel throttle is at the halfway point. When the ignition switch is turned from ON to off, the throttle is fully closed temporarily.

step1.ptxt: Data List Related to Black Smoke

item.ptxt: Engine Speed
MAP
MAF
Intake Air
Coolant Temp
Engine Speed of Cyl #1 (to #8)
(Output only when the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test is performed)
Target Common Rail Pressure
Common Rail Pressure
Target Pump SCV Current
Injection Feedback Val #1 (to #8)
Injection Volume
Actual Throttle Position
Actual Throttle Position #2
Target EGR Valve Pos
Actual EGR Valve Pos
EGR Close Lrn. Val.
After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).
After replacing a fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration (Click here ).

atten4.ptxt: Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle age. Do not assume the vehicle to be normal when the Data List outputs standard values. There may be concealed factors of the malfunction.

entry.ptxt: The fuel used in diesel engines has a higher boiling point and evaporates much slower than that used in gasoline engines. Additionally, the fuel is injected directly, so the air fuel mixture in diesel engines is formed in a very short period of time and is less homogenous. This is why diesel engines must operate with a larger air fuel ratio across the entire operating range. An insufficient quantity of air results in imperfect combustion and increased particulate (soot) emissions.

When the accelerator pedal is depressed, a large amount of fuel is injected. As a result, the air fuel ratio becomes rich. In this relatively rich environment, fuel droplets lacking in oxygen burn imperfectly producing soot, which is emitted as black smoke. In order to prevent black smoke production, the maximum injection quantity for a given intake air mass is limited (final injection quantity is limited by MAF).
Black smoke is emitted when either: 1) a lack of oxygen is present during combustion, or 2) too much fuel is injected for a given intake air mass and the air fuel ratio becomes temporarily rich.

testgrp.testtitle: READ OUTPUT DTC (RELATING TO ENGINE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

atten4.ptxt: If only DTC P1609 is output, proceed to step 2.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR BLACK SMOKE

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and drive the vehicle until the engine coolant temperature reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Stop the vehicle and allow the engine to idle.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it.*1
Repeat the above procedure *1 10 times or more.*2
Check for black smoke emission during procedures *1 and *2.

specitem.ptxt: Black smoke is emitted less than 5 times.

item.ptxt: Even if the black smoke is very thin, count the number of black smoke emissions if there is any visible smoke.

If the procedure is repeated 10 times or more and black smoke stops being emitted, this probably means that the black smoke was caused by a temporary accumulation of soot which occurred when driving at low speeds, and is not a malfunction.

testgrp.testtitle: RECOVERY TO NORMAL

atten4.ptxt: If the racing procedure is repeated 10 times or more and black smoke stops being emitted, this probably means that the black smoke was caused by a temporary accumulation of soot which occurred when driving at low speeds, and is not a malfunction.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM FRONT EXHAUST PIPE ASSEMBLY (DPF CATALYTIC CONVERTERS) TO BE REPLACED

test1.ptxt: Even though it has been determined that the front exhaust pipe assembly (DPF catalytic converter) needs to be replaced, make sure to complete diagnosis for this problem before replacing it.
Click here

item.ptxt: Replace the DPF catalytic converter for bank 1 and bank 2 at the same time.
After the DPF catalytic converter is replaced, perform "catalyst record clear".
Click here
This problem occurred because an excessive amount of PM has accumulated and resulted in abnormal combustion. It is necessary to diagnose the cause of abnormal PM accumulation and repair the problem.
Therefore, do not perform replacement at this time.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check for air leakage and blockage between the air cleaner cap and turbocharger sub-assembly, and between the turbocharger sub-assembly and intake manifold.

item.ptxt: Make sure that the air cleaner is not clogged and the intake and exhaust system hoses are not disconnected.
When the vacuum hoses are disconnected.
Check that the intercooler is not clogged with foreign matter.
Check that there are no disconnected, pinched or leaking hoses or pipes.
Check that there are no modifications made by the user.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WIRE HARNESS AND CONNECTION IN ENGINE COMPARTMENT

test1.ptxt: Check the wire harness and connector connections of common rail system components.

specitem.ptxt: The wire harnesses and connectors are connected securely.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE

test1.ptxt: Read the injector compensation codes.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: Compensation codes stored in the ECM match the compensation codes of the installed injector assemblies.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING (DETAIL)

test1.ptxt: Perform the pilot quantity learning (detail).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR BLACK SMOKE

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and drive the vehicle until the engine coolant temperature reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Stop the vehicle and allow the engine to idle.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it.*1
Repeat the above procedure *1 10 times.*2
Check for black smoke emission during procedures *1 and *2.

specitem.ptxt: Black smoke is emitted less than 5 times.

atten4.ptxt: Even if the black smoke is very thin, count the number of black smoke emissions if there is any visible smoke.

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING IDLING AND 4000 RPM (AFTER ENGINE WARMED UP)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Black Smoke.
Take a snapshot of the following Data List items.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting. The data in the list below is that of a normal vehicle, but as the data varies between individual vehicles, this data should only be used for reference.
Graphs like the ones shown below can be displayed by transferring the stored snapshot data from the GTS to a PC. Intelligent Viewer must be installed on the PC.
Check the Data List at idling and at 4000 rpm with no load after the engine is warmed up.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF AND MAP)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Warm up the engine (the engine coolant temperature is 75°C (167°F) or higher).
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot when the engine speed is maintained at 3000 rpm with no load.
Read the values of "MAP" and "MAF" in the Data List using the snapshot review function.

entry.ptxt: MAF 68 gm/sec or more and MAP 110 kPa or higher

item.ptxt: The shift lever should be in neutral and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off.

The above values were measured under the standard atmospheric pressure. The values are influenced by elevation, weather conditions, etc. The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (INJECTION VOLUME AND INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val # and Injection Volume in the snapshot taken after the engine is warmed up and idled for 1 minute.

entry.ptxt: Injection Volume is less than 5.5 mm3/st at 3000 rpm
Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than +3 mm3/st

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF ALL CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CHECK THE CYLINDER COMPRESSION)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to help determine whether a cylinder has compression loss or not.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Check the Cylinder Compression / Data List / Compression / Engine Speed of Cyl #1 to #8.
Check the engine speed during the Active Test.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

entry.ptxt: The values of Engine Speed Cyl #1 to #8 are within 10 rpm of each other

atten4.ptxt: When cranking, if the speed of a cylinder is approximately 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, there is probably a complete loss of compression in that cylinder.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK CYLINDER COMPRESSION PRESSURE OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

atten4.ptxt: Measure the compression of the cylinder that had a high speed during the Active Test "Check the Cylinder Compression".

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

action.actiontitle: CHECK ENGINE TO DETERMINE CAUSE OF LOW COMPRESSION

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation code.
Click here
Perform the injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR BLACK SMOKE

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and drive the vehicle until the engine coolant temperature reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Stop the vehicle and allow the engine to idle.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it.*1
Repeat the above procedure *1 10 times.*2
Check for black smoke emission during procedures *1 and *2.

specitem.ptxt: Black smoke is emitted less than 5 times.

atten4.ptxt: Even if the black smoke is very thin, count the number of black smoke emissions if there is any visible smoke.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND ATMOSPHERE PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Atmosphere Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Compare MAP to Atmosphere Pressure when the ignition switch to ON (the engine is stopped).

item.ptxt: If MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have the same value, both are normal. If there is a difference of 10 kPa (0.1 kgf/cm2, 1.5 psi) or more, compare the values to the atmospheric pressure for that day. The sensor whose deviation is the greatest is malfunctioning.

The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa (1.0 kgf/cm2, 15 psi). For every 100 m (328 ft.) increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa (0.01 kgf/cm2, 0.1 psi). This varies by weather (high atmospheric pressure, low atmospheric pressure).

entry.ptxt: MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have same value
Atmosphere Pressure is different from actual atmospheric pressure
MAP is different from actual atmospheric pressure

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (TEST THE FUEL LEAK)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak / Data List / Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Take a snapshot with the GTS during the Active Test.
Measure the difference between the target fuel pressure (Target Common Rail Pressure) and the actual fuel pressure (Common Rail Pressure) when the "Test the Fuel Leak" Active Test is performed.

atten4.ptxt: In order to obtain an exact measurement, perform the Active Test 5 times and measure the difference once each time the Active Test is performed.

specitem.ptxt: The difference between the target fuel pressure and the actual fuel pressure 2 seconds after the Active Test starts is less than 10000 kPa (102.0 kgf/cm2, 1451 psi).

item.ptxt: "Target Common Rail Pressure" is the target fuel pressure controlled by the ECM.
"Common Rail Pressure" is the actual fuel pressure in the common rail assembly.

If the pressure discharge valve mounted on the common rail assembly is malfunctioning, the actual fuel pressure may change as indicated by "Pressure Discharge Valve Abnormal Common Rail Pressure" in the illustration.
The pressure discharge valve operates to discharge fuel pressure when the internal pressure of the common rail exceeds the target fuel pressure.

There are 2 fuel pressure sensor circuits and both of them display the same value. If the difference between Common Rail Pressure exceeds 10000 kPa (102 kgf/cm2, 1451 psi) for 2 seconds or more, it is necessary to inspect or repair the wiring for the fuel pressure sensor.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (ENGINE COOLANT TEMPERATURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Soak the engine for a long time.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Coolant Temp.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

specitem.ptxt: Coolant Temp is the same as the ambient temperature.

atten4.ptxt: When the engine coolant temperature is low even though the engine has been fully warmed up, or when the engine coolant temperature is high even though the engine is cold, inspect the sensor.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INTAKE AIR AND INTAKE AIR TEMP (TURBO))

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Soak the engine for a long time.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Intake Air and Intake Air Temp (Turbo).

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

specitem.ptxt: Intake Air is the same as Intake Air Temp (Turbo).

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the suction control valve connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: r2-1 (+B) or C39-104 (PCV+) - Body ground and other terminals
r2-2 (PCV) or C39-105 (PCV-) - Body ground and other terminals

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the suction control valve connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK IF FUEL IS BEING SUPPLIED TO FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the inlet hose from the fuel supply pump assembly.
Operate the priming pump and check that fuel is being supplied to the fuel supply pump assembly.

specitem.ptxt: Fuel is properly supplied to the fuel supply pump assembly when the priming pump is operated.

item.ptxt: When there is a lack of fuel, the fuel pressure drops.
Inspect for fuel filter clogging (Check that the fuel filter is not clogged).

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the inlet hose.

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

test1.ptxt: Perform fuel supply pump initialization.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FOR BLACK SMOKE

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and drive the vehicle until the engine coolant temperature reaches 75°C (167°F) or higher.
Stop the vehicle and allow the engine to idle.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal for 5 seconds, and then release it.*1
Repeat the above procedure *1 10 times.*2
Check for black smoke emission during procedures *1 and *2.

specitem.ptxt: Black smoke is emitted less than 5 times.

atten4.ptxt: Even if the black smoke is very thin, count the number of black smoke emissions if there is any visible smoke.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE EGR VALVE CLOSE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off. Wait for 30 seconds, and then restart the engine.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the GTS while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the EGR Valve Close / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value when the EGR valve is closed using the Active Test function.

item.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.
Before performing the diagnosis, confirm that the EGR valve target opening angle is not 0%.

atten3.ptxt: As the measured values may differ from those shown below due to factors such as differences in measuring environments and changes in vehicle condition due to aging, do not use these values to determine whether the vehicle is malfunctioning or not.

atten4.ptxt: The problem may be a temporary one, due to the entry of deposits or foreign matter. Check that there are no deposits or foreign matter in the electric EGR control valve assembly or mass air flow meter sub-assembly.

item.ptxt: Atmosphere pressure: 101 kPa
Engine coolant temperature: 75°C (167°F)

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF and Engine speed.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and read the value when 30 seconds has elapsed.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (ACTIVATE THE VSV FOR EGR COOLER BYPASS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and make sure the A/C switch and all accessory switches are off.
Turn the ignition switch off and wait for 30 seconds.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the MAF value displayed on the GTS while the engine is idling.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass / Data List / EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

atten4.ptxt: Whether the EGR is passing through the bypass side or cooler side during the Active Test can be confirmed by checking EGR Cooler Bypass Position.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

app-param-unit.app-param: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass

test1.ptxt: Using the Active Test function, switch the EGR valve bypass switching valve between "Cooler" and "Bypass" a few times, and then check whether the MAF value changes after switching the valve from "Cooler" to "Bypass".

atten4.ptxt: If idling continues for 20 minutes or more, the EGR valve target opening angle becomes 0% (EGR valve fully closed). As this makes diagnosis impossible, it becomes necessary to drive the vehicle or restart the engine.

entry.ptxt: Activate the VSV for EGR Cooler Bypass:

item.ptxt: If the EGR cooler sub-assembly is clogged, the mass air flow changes.
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch even with no clogging in the EGR cooler, the intake air flow will not change.
The bypass valve switch is determined by negative pressure changes and operating sound.
Vacuum inspection.
Click here
Operating sound inspection.
Click here
If the bypass valve does not mechanically switch, perform the repairs listed below and replace the part. Then check for changes in the intake air flow by performing the Active Test again.
No. 2 EGR valve assembly
Click here
Vacuum hose connection
Click here
Vacuum switching valve assembly (for EGR bypass valve)
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REMOVE DEPOSIT (ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY)

test1.ptxt: Remove the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here
Visually check the electric EGR control valve assembly for deposits. If there are deposits, clean the electric EGR control valve assembly.

item.ptxt: When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, make sure the valve is completely closed.
When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, perform initialization procedure.
Click here
Do not forcibly open the valve, as it may be damaged or deformed.

When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, use a piece of cloth soaked with cleaning solvent. Spraying the solvent directly onto these parts or soaking the parts in the solvent may damage the parts.
If the EGR valve does not open properly or is stuck closed, the amount of intake air increases and combustion sounds and engine vibration may increase.

If the EGR valve does not close properly or is stuck open, EGR becomes excessive and combustion becomes unstable. Also, there may be a lack of power. In this case, clean the electric EGR control valve assembly.

test1.ptxt: Reinstall the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE EGR COOLER ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the EGR cooler assembly.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If foreign matter is stuck inside the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, the output characteristics of the mass air flow meter sub-assembly may change, resulting in a malfunction.
